User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0

When I visit a korean encoded site, daum.net, Mac OS X keyboard automatically change to Korean and it does not change back to U.S. keyboard.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Have two keyboard enabled on your macbook
  1) System Preference - Language & Text - Input Sources
  2) Check 3 boxes
     . Keyboard & Characer Viewer
     . Hangul
     . U.S.
  3) Use the same one in all document
2. Type url "daum.net" in address box, then Enter
3. It will end up with www.daum.net with keyboard layout is changed from U.S. to "2-Set Korean"
Actual Results:  
Keyboard layout is changed to "2-Set Korean" and it does not change back to "U.S" although I select english encoded page tab.

Even I type in terminal, it stays in Korean.

Expected Results:  
It should not change system-wide keyboard setting to Korean although I visit a Korean site.

FF4 must not touch system-wide keyboard setting unless user wants to change it manually.

N/A

I've encountered somewhat similar bug in Firefox 61.0 running on Gentoo Linux

sometimes keyboard layout unexpectedly switches to Russian and I am unable to switch it back to English.
I have several X sessions with different users logged in, and this happens only to one of them.
I've even removed all keyboard layouts from settings, but it still happens
